Type.Name: GlyphString

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GlyphString extends GLib.Opaque

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Used to store strings of glyphs with geometry and visual attribute information.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Extents (Pango.Font font, Pango.Rectangle ink_rect, Pango.Rectangle logical_rect);
.method public hidebysig instance void Extents(class Pango.Font font, valuetype Pango.Rectangle ink_rect, valuetype Pango.Rectangle logical_rect) cil managed

Docs.param: a for rendering the string
a used to store the extents of the glyph as drawn or to indicate that the result is not needed.
a used to store the logical extents of the glyph or to indicate that the result is not needed.
Docs.summary: Computes the logical and ink extents of this glyph string.
Docs.remarks: The coordinate system for each rectangle has its origin at the base line and horizontal origin of the character with increasing coordinates extending to the right and down. The units of the rectangles are in 1 / of a device unit.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ExtentsRange (int start, int end, Pango.Font font, Pango.Rectangle ink_rect, Pango.Rectangle logical_rect);
.method public hidebysig instance void ExtentsRange(int32 start, int32 end, class Pango.Font font, valuetype Pango.Rectangle ink_rect, valuetype Pango.Rectangle logical_rect) cil managed

Docs.param: an integer for the start index
an integer for the end index
a for rendering the string
a used to store the extents of the glyph as drawn or to indicate that the result is not needed.
a used to store the logical extents of the glyph or to indicate that the result is not needed.
Docs.summary: Computes the logical and ink extents of a sub-section of this glyph string.
Docs.remarks: The extents are relative to the start of the glyph string range, not to the start of the glyph string.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetLogicalWidths (string text, int embedding_level);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GetLogicalWidths(string text, int32 embedding_level) cil managed

Docs.param: a to process
a , the embedding level of the string
Docs.summary: Determine the screen width corresponding to each character in a string. When multiple characters compose a single cluster, the width of the entire cluster is divided equally among the characters.
Docs.returns: a , a pointer to an array of logical widths for each character.

MemberSignature.Value: public static GLib.GType GType { get; }
.property valuetype GLib.GType GType
public int IndexToX (string text, Pango.Analysis analysis, int index_, bool trailing);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 IndexToX(string text, valuetype Pango.Analysis analysis, int32 index_, bool trailing) cil managed

Docs.param: a , the text for the run
a , the analysis for the run
a , the byte index within the text.
a whether to compute from trailing edge (true) or leading edge (false) of the character
Docs.summary: Convert from character position to X position.
Docs.remarks: Converts from character position to x position. (X position is measured from the left edge of the run). Character positions are computed by dividing up each cluster into equal portions.

MemberSignature.Value: public void XToIndex (string text, Pango.Analysis analysis, int x_pos, out int index_, out int trailing);
.method public hidebysig instance void XToIndex(string text, valuetype Pango.Analysis analysis, int32 x_pos, int32 index_, int32 trailing) cil managed

Docs.param: a , the text for the run
a , the analysis for the run
the X offset in Pango glyph units.
a , for storing the calculated byte index
a for storing whether the user clicked on the leading or trailing edge of the character.
Docs.summary: Convert from x offset to character position.
Docs.remarks: Character positions are computed by dividing up each cluster into equal portions. In scripts where positioning within a cluster is not allowed (such as Thai), the returned value may not be a valid cursor position; the caller must combine the result with the logical attributes for the text to compute the valid cursor position.
